column4: Hello I just did apt-get install java-package but I get - E: Couldn't find package java-package
first of all there is no need to log into your computer as root, sudo can do anything you need. and hold on while I check something
I'm on a remote machine. I will create a user account.
some of the java stuff is in multiverse
enable multiverse, do "sudo apt-get update" (without quotes) and then: apt-cache search -n sun-java6
it's commented out in your sources.list, you need to enable it
hold on while I paste my sources.list
Ok, that is Hardy Herron, if anyone asks :)
and here is my sources.list but you need to change "Intrepid" to "Hardy" if you use any of it: http://paste.ubuntu.com/77992/
and if you change your sources.list you will need to do this to update your sources: sudo apt-get update
do you have another package manager open somewhere?
all package managers use the same sources so only one can run at a time, close any others and try again
that's weird because 91.189.88.46 resolves to http://archive.ubuntu.com/ for me
